text:
Hi,

I ran 1.3 (not sure which version), and then upgraded to 1.3.29 yesterday. Now,
suddenly some pictures dissappeared from my website.

All those photos seem to contain characters well-known here in Norway : ÆØÅæøå

How to produce this problem:

1. Create a file in htdocs with the filename øø.gif
2. Apache will say 404- not found   when trying to access the file.

Please fix!

How do you access the file? Non-ascii characters in URLs are not allowed. The
behaviour of URL-encoded octets in URLs is undefined.

So what do you want to be fixed?
creator: nd@perlig.de
wrowe@apache.org
text:
"How do you access the file? Non-ascii characters in URLs are not allowed."

Actually they are.  But they have to be escaped.

In any case, apache 1.3 didn't support multibyte codepages for filespecs.
In apache 2.0, internally -everything- is a utf-8 name, and URL's can be
given in internationally portable utf-8 (properly escaped, of course.)

Closing as won't fix - move to apache 2.0.
